page.title: 09Greenhow Hill Farm, Gt.Ayton
page.content: This farm is on the western edge of Gt. Ayton. The buildings are on a very low hill a few metres above the stell that drains this area into the River Leven. Mr.L.Martin owns and farms this land with the help of his wife and two workers. He owns 225 acres and rents a further 30. Much of the land is under rotational grass for his dairy herd and some sheep, but he also grows wheat, barley, potatoes, oats, turnips, peas and 'Tyflon' (an experimental green crop). The farm used to be two seperate units, but now includes Manor Grange's fields:this typical of many local farms.
